sentence.Network_en: This does not mean that we wish to fetter the trade union movement.
sentence.Network_cn: 这并不意味着我们想限制工会运动.

sentence.Network_en: A clog or fetter on the equity of redemption is void.
sentence.Network_cn: 阻碍和束缚衡平法上的赎回板均是无效的.

sentence.Network_en: We reverence tradition but will not is fetter by it.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们尊敬传统,但不愿被它束缚.

list.abs: the Renaissance is enables Europe to get rid the decayed feudal religion fetter , expands a prelude to the world .文艺复兴是使欧洲摆脱腐朽的封建宗教束缚，向全世界扩张的一个前奏曲。

to drag a man in fetters into the grand illuminated temple of liberty , and call upon him to join you in joyous anthems , were inhuman mockery and sacrilegious irony .将一个身着镣铐的人拖过自由的雄伟光辉的圣殿，叫他和你们一起高唱欢乐的圣歌，不啻是惨无人道的嘲弄和亵渎神明的讽刺。
I since then take endless sorrow and recollection to run fastthe midnight and that innumerable miserable back is a depressed fetter ;我自午夜而来，带着无尽的悲伤和回忆疾走，那无数凄凉的背后，是沉闷的枷锁；

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English feter, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch veter 'a lace', from an Indo-European root shared by foot

entry.def: If you say that you are fettered by something, you dislike it because it prevents you from behaving or moving in a free and natural way.

example.ex: ...a private trust which would not be fettered by bureaucracy...
example.tran: 不受官僚繁文缛节限制的私人信托

example.ex: The black mud fettered her movements.
example.tran: 黑色的稀泥限制了她的行动。

entry.tran: (规则、传统、责任的)束缚，约束，桎梏
entry.def: You can use fetters to refer to things such as rules, traditions, or responsibilities that you dislike because they prevent you from behaving in the way you want.
Especially in former times, fetters were chains for a prisoner's feet.

example.ex: He saw a boy in fetters in the dungeons.
example.tran: 他在地牢里看见一个戴着脚镣的男孩。

means.word_mean: 1. a shackle for the ankles or feet

auth_sentence.content: His neck chafed against the starched fetter of a collar.
auth_sentence.res_content: His neck chafed against the starched fetter of a collar.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His neck chafed against the starched fetter of a collar.

auth_sentence.content: A dinner engagement...is no longer a fetter, Because liars can just...lie their way out of it.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: A dinner engagement...is no longer a fetter, Because liars can just...lie their way out of it.

auth_sentence.content: "It makes strategic sense for us," said Trevor Fetter, Tenet's CEO, in an interview.
auth_sentence.res_content: "It makes strategic sense for us," said Trevor Fetter, Tenet's CEO, in an interview.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: "It makes strategic sense for us," said Trevor Fetter, Tenet's CEO, in an interview.

sentences.en: No man loves his fetters,be they made of gold.
sentences.cn: 即使是金子做的镣铐,也没人喜欢。

sentences.en: They will run wild freed from the fetters of control.
sentences.cn: 他们一旦摆脱了束缚,就会变得无法无天。

sentences.en: This does not mean that we wish to fetter the trade union movement.
sentences.cn: 这并不意味着我们想限制工会运动。
